newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Leykam off in Vienna on investment stop.
newsitem.headline: Leykam off in Vienna on investment stop.

text.p: Shares in Austrian paper maker Leykam-Muertztaler, slumped 6.56 percent on the Vienna bourse on Friday after the firm's Dutch parent said it was abandoning further investment in its paper producing unit KNP Leykam.
At 1005 GMT Leykam-Muerztaler shares were the biggest loser, down 21 schillings at 299 on 19,218 lots.
"News of the investment stop has hardly been greeted by euphoria. The share price could come off further but there looks to be support around 285 schillings," a trader said.
"Not investing stands for neglecting," added another.
KNP BT has a 72 percent stake in Leykam-Muerztaler which in turn holds around 30 percent of KNP Leykam.
Leykam-Muerztaler paper production is centred in Gratkorn, in the province of Styria.
